Thanks!

item.title: Help with PHP & MySQL
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

You need to import the .SQL file, not the .PHP file.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with PHP & MySQL
item.dc:creator: @Tr7 Tr7
item.description:
@Tr7 wrote:

What would I import it as? (Using PhpMyAdmin)

CSV Open Document Spreadsheet XML SQL
Those are all my options phpmyadmin gives me for importing a file into a database. Which one should I use then?

Read full topic

Why are you trying to import a PHP file as SQL?

item.title: Help with PHP & MySQL
item.dc:creator: @Tr7 Tr7
item.description:
@Tr7 wrote:

Okay, so I decided to mess around with an iXat private server today and after making the database, I try to import the file, “index.php”. After attempting to do so, I get the following error:

#1064 - You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near '9<?php header("Location: /lobby")' at line 1
This is what’s on my line 1 in index.php:

9<?php header("Location: /lobby"); die(); $swf = "http://ixat.com.br/chat.swf"; if($_GET['login'] != ""){ $swf = "http://ixat.com.br/login.swf"; } ?>

Please, if you can, help me with this.

ALSO: Here is another part of the error:

ERROR: Unknown Punctuation String @ 2 STR: <? SQL: 9<?php header("Location: /lobby");
I really need this fixed so if you can please help me out!

Read full topic
